description: Phonecians develop a phonemic system of writing
importance: Much less complicated than Egyptian hyroglyphics, consisting of only 22 characters

description: Alexander the Great conquers a massive empire
importance: Produces the Hellenistic culture with influence from cultures throughout his empire

description: The Qin Dynasty established China as a unified state
importance: China goes on to be history's longest enduring society

description: Discoveries of silver begin in north and central Europe
importance: Infused capital into Europe, helping economic development

description: St Denis cathedral completed in Paris
importance: The first monument of Gothic Architecture

description: Reading glasses invented in Northern Italy (Between 1268 and 1289)
importance: Extended the working life of scholars and artisans as well as improved productivity

description: St Thomas Aquinas begins writing Summa Theologica
importance: Gathered together all of the main questions of theology, doctrine, ethics, and more

description: University of Bologna founded
importance: Was the first degree-granting institution of higher education

description: Cistercian order of monks/nuns established
importance: Gave the most self-denying believers a home

description: Black death begins to spread through Europe (from China starting in Crimea in Europe)
importance: Killed up to one-third or one-half of the population in some regions

description: Charles VII of France establishes Europe's first standing army
importance: Gave an advantage to centralized monarchies, allowing for political absolutism

description: Philip and Alexander of Macedon begin combined-arms doctrine
importance: Created the most sophisticated and adaptable forces of ancient times

description: Colombus lands in the Bahamas on his first voyage
importance: In August 1492, Columbus sailed the ocean blue. October 12th they sighted land, And set their feet upon new sand

description: United East India company was founded
importance: It becomes the worlds first publically traded, multinational LLC

description: Permanent recapture of Jerusalem by Muslims
importance: The possesion of Jerusalem has been long contested by different religions

description: Johannes Gutenberg invents the printing press
importance: Helped to spread the printed word, allowing for easy reproduction of books

description: University of CÃ³rdoba library destroyed, along with its (estimated) 400,000 volumes
importance: This library would not be matched in size without a revolution in printing

description: Chinese artisans invented paper
importance: It was a type of material that would spread writing throughout the world

description: Michaelangelo sculpts David
importance: Demonstrated a mastery of skill, to be renowned forever

description: St. Bartholomew's Day massacre
importance: Resulted in the death of some 20,000 Protestants throughout France

description: John Wyclif completes the first English-language translation of the Bible
importance: Helped spread Christianity to English speaking nations

description: Galileo begins clash with church over heliocentrism
importance: This idea would later be accepted as scientific truth, although refuted by church at the time

description: Newton publishes Principia, describing his 3 laws of motion
importance: One of the most important advancements in physics to date

description: Dimitrii Mendeleev conceives the periodic table
importance: A first way to organize the discovered elements by their properties, still used today!

description: New York Stock & Exchange Board founded
importance: Today it is, by far, the world's largest stock exchange

description: Bank of England created
importance: Most modern banks are based on the model created by Bank of England

description: John Bennet patents the first artificial fertilizer
importance: Important in the scientific improvement of agriculture

description: Machiavelli writes The Prince
importance: The Prince informed leaders strategies through which they can form powerful states

description: Magna Carta signed
importance: The Magna Carta established the principle that everyone is subject to the law, even the king

description: English Bill of Rights passed by Parliament
importance: Created separation of power, limitation of power for monarchs, enahnces the democrait election, and enforces the right to free speech

description: The US Surpreme Court rules that corporations have inherent rights
importance: Made being a corporation a more ideal business form, as restrictions by government were eased

description: Joint Stock Companies Act
importance: Expanded access to the incorporation of joint-stock companies, however, did not offer limited liability for corporations

description: Edmund Cartwright invents the power loom
importance: Major factor in the industrialization of weaving

description: Chicago's Home Insurance building completed
importance: The world's first skyscraper

description: Nikola Tesla created the Alternating Current (AC) system
importance: Allowed for much more feasible transfer of power over long distances, spreading electricity usage

description: The Wright brothers achieved the first successful controlled, sustained, flight
importance: They pioneered air travel for the future, along with many other applications of aircraft

description: Hitler comes to power
importance: Commits mass genocide and becomes one of the most hated figures in history

description: USSR Collapses
importance: This signals the end of the Cold War

description: Cuban Missile Crisis
importance: At this point, the Cold War was close to escalating into a full nuclear war between the USSR and the United States

description: Brown v. Board of Education overturns Plessy v. Ferguson
importance: Declared segregation in public schools to be unconstitutional

description: 13th Ammendment Passed in the Senate
importance: Abolishes slavery and involuntary servitude in the United States

description: Civil Rights Act of 1964
importance: Discrimination and segregation deemed illegal by Congress
